subject: Business
title: Platform Strategy: Building Ecosystems
description: Learn Platform Strategy: Building Ecosystems in one minute.

hook.text: Microsoft didn't beat competitors with better software. It won by making everyone else build on Windows.

buildup.text: A platform strategy creates value by enabling interactions between producers and consumers.

discovery.text: Platforms beat products because each new participant adds value. More apps attract more users attract more apps.

twist.text: Platform power is almost impossible to compete away once established. The ecosystem itself is the moat.

climax.text: Apple's App Store generates $80B+ annually. Apple builds the platform; millions of developers build the value.

punchline.text: Build the stage. Let others perform on it.

quiz.question: Why are platforms harder to compete against than products?
options: The ecosystem of participants creates a self-reinforcing moat
Platform companies have better marketing teams
